title: Rafael Nadal advances to last four of the ATP Finals after beating Stefanos Tsitsipas
description: Rafael Nadal progressed into the final four of the ATP Finals for the first time in five years after beating Stefanos Tsitsipas -- 6-4 4-6 6-2 -- on Thursday.

title: Giuliani and the Trump legal team's wild press conference
description:
• Live updates: Biden begins transition plans as Trump refuses to concede
• Inside Giuliani's attempt to sow chaos on behalf of Trump and steal the election

title: Major coronavirus outbreak hits crew of US Navy warship
description: There has been a major coronavirus outbreak aboard a US Navy guided missile destroyer, the USS Michael Murphy, which has spread to nearly one-quarter of the ship's 300 strong-crew, according to two US Navy officials.

title: Lori Loughlin's husband reports to prison for college admissions scandal
description: Fashion designer Mossimo Giannulli, the husband of actress Lori Loughlin, reported to prison Thursday to begin his five-month sentence at the Federal Correctional Complex Lompoc, according to prison spokeswoman Suzanne Scott.

title: 16 dead in protests over Bobi Wine's arrest
description: Sixteen people have been killed in Kampala in two days of protest over the arrest of presidential opposition candidate Bobi Wine.

title: Trump team's focus: 'Iran, Iran, Iran'
description: New York Times reporter Ronen Bergman says the White House is using the time it has left to exercise a tougher Iran policy than they expect from Joe Biden.

title: 'Fresh Prince' reunion squashes Will Smith's decades-old rivalry
description: "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" costar Janet Hubert, known for the role of Aunt Viv, sits down with Will Smith to discuss tensions on set which led to her release from the show.

title: Anchor explains why CNN didn't air Giuliani's 'bananas' briefing
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down who is on the Trump campaign's legal team as they file a mounting number of election fraud lawsuits.

title: The end is near for famed 'GoldenEye' telescope
description: After decades of aiding astronomical discoveries, one of the most powerful telescopes on Earth will cease its observation of the universe after sustaining irreparable damage.

title: See dogs react to a Christmas song created just for them
description: "Raise the Woof," a Christmas song for dogs has been released. The canine jingle was created based on scientific research into the ways dogs interact with sound.

title: Michael J. Fox retiring again because of health
description: Michael J. Fox is reportedly retiring again because of health concerns.

title: Van Jones explains the various ways a contested election can unfold
description: Certifying election results is typically a formality, but the process has become a battleground as President Trump's campaign tries to block or delay certification in key states in hopes of overturning Joe Biden's victory through the Electoral College. CNN political commentator Van Jones explains the various ways a contested election can unfold.

title: Apple to pay $113 million over deliberately slowing down iPhones
description: Apple has agreed to pay millions of dollars to 34 states over its controversial previous practice of deliberately slowing down older iPhones to extend their battery life.

title: How robots could save one of the world's most unusual cathedrals
description: Barcelona's most famous landmark has all the makings of a fantastic blockbuster movie: politically savvy priests, robots, vigilante revolutionaries, the husband of the Virgin Mary, a seemingly mad but brilliant architect, vandals, desecrators, and 138 years of a still-unfolding plot.

title: Doctor was called a liar after sharing battle with Covid-19
description: 28-year-old Dr. David Burkard shares a cautionary tale after his battle with Covid-19 left him struggling to breathe. CNN's Sara Sidner has the details.

title: A gym trainer exposed 50 athletes to Covid-19, but no one else got sick because of a ventilation redesign
description: A Virginia gym owner thought she had a nightmare scenario on her hands when she learned that 50 athletes were potentially exposed to Covid-19 particles by one of the gym's coaches. But not a single member ended up contracting the virus, thanks to the extra safety precautions and ventilation measures she put in place.

title: Hit Netflix show 'The Queen's Gambit' will speed up chess 'boom,' say grandmasters
description: The success of Netflix's latest hit show has taken even one of the men behind the series by surprise.

title: Charles Yu's 'Interior Chinatown' wins National Book Award for Fiction
description: Author and TV writer Charles Yu won the National Book Award for Fiction on Wednesday night with his novel "Interior Chinatown," a satire about typecasting and racism in Hollywood.

title: Ishita Malaviya, India's first female surfer, is changing her country's perception of the ocean
description: Despite an abundance of coastline, long stretches of beach and swell on both sides of the country, India has traditionally been a surf-shy nation. But over the past decade, the tide has gradually started to turn.

title: While Trump sulks, Americans get sick and die
description: As the US speeds past the tragic mark of a quarter of a million Covid-19 deaths, its President is sulking in the White House over an election he lost fair and square and obstructing the effort by his soon-to-be successor, Joe Biden, to stand up a fight against the fast-worsening pandemic.

title: The DRC declares the end to its 11th Ebola outbreak
description: The Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) officially declared the end of its 11th Ebola outbreak Wednesday, six months after the first cases of the deadly virus were reported.

title: Elite Australian troops unlawfully killed 39 Afghan civilians amid a culture of 'bloodlust,' report alleges
description: Australian elite forces unlawfully killed 39 Afghan civilians, including farmers and prisoners, operating in a culture where "war crimes were tolerated," a long-awaited official report has alleged.

title: How Trump is intentionally making things more difficult for Biden
description: President Donald Trump continues to howl on Twitter -- between rounds of golf -- spreading the lie that he won the election he lost, and promising he will be in the White House come January.

title: I went to Queensland for lunch and was stranded for three months
description: My trip was supposed to be simple. I was attending a lunch for the Australian Society of Travel Writers in the town of Ipswich, on the outskirts of the state's capital Brisbane.

title: How arranged marriages are evolving in India
description: Ananya was 15 when she watched her older sister marry a man she barely knew.

title: The end of the Pelosi era is in sight
description: Nancy Pelosi has been the dominant figure among House Democrats for the better part of the last two decades.

title: Obama's insights on Merkel, Putin and other leaders in his new book
description: How's Joe Biden supposed to get anything done?

title: Top ethics experts and Trump critics demand investigation into Graham's election probe
Current and former Trump officials quietly reach out to Biden team
Nigella Lawson butters her toast twice, and Britain is really angry about it
description: There are a handful of culinary quagmires that, for no clear reason and to the bafflement of the rest of the world, bitterly divide Britain: the correct pronunciation of "scone," for example, or at what stage in the tea-making process one should add milk.

title: Thai parliament votes on constitutional reform after night of chaos
description: Thailand's parliament was voting on motions seeking constitutional reform on Wednesday, a day after the worst night of violence in the country's five-month protest movement saw live ammunition used for the first time and left more than 50 people injured.

title: Angry citizens criticize election officials for hours. See why
description: Republican members of Michigan's Wayne County Board of Canvassers reversed their vote to certify election results after being criticized for hours by citizens who attended the public meeting.

title: 'The Greatest Shoal on Earth': Protecting South Africa's sardine run
description: From above, it looks like a vast oil spill spreading across the ocean. It's been called the "Greatest Shoal on Earth" and it's one of the planet's biggest migrations in terms of biomass.

title: BioNTech and Pfizer will seek emergency US authorization for vaccine on Friday
Tropical Storm Iota deals devastation to Central America still recovering from Eta
description: Tropical storm Iota has devastated Central America, leaving residents to wade through the wreckage of two storms in a matter of weeks.

title: A Dutch grocery giant is buying FreshDirect
description: Ahold Delhaize, the Netherlands-based owner of US supermarket chains Stop & Shop, Giant and Food Lion, is buying the online grocery service FreshDirect as demand for online grocery shopping accelerates in the pandemic.

title: Biden acknowledges 'real brick walls' he'll face in Senate
description: President-elect Joe Biden acknowledged in a private video call with supporters on Wednesday that he will face "real brick walls" in the Senate if Republicans maintain their majority but said he thinks he can overcome the political divides that may exist.

title: JPMorgan lays out election 'horror story' scenario that could send markets into tailspin
